website_summaries.verdict: Ultra-lightweight and compact, you can channel your inner Mary Poppins.
pros: Classic style at a great price point – it even has a real wood handle with finger notches
Designed with a vented double canopy
The perfect size for keeping in a purse
Its automatic open and close will also reset the umbrella, should it ever invert
The manufacturer offers excellent customer service
cons: While the opening mechanism is smooth, closing the umbrella is slightly tricky

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this umbrella. Simply put: 1. Sturdy construction, well-built. 2. Does not invert with strong winds. 3. Wood handle feels great in the grip. 4. Small enough to travel, big enough to keep me dry. It hit all the check boxes and has been a great umbrella for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A. Gruner

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully crafted wooden handle and feels much better than expected. I always thought nothing would feel better than a rubberized handle for enhanced grip but boy I was wrong. Though the true plus point of this umbrella is the material of the canopy. It is extremely water repellant and does not take much effort to shake any excess water off of it. If you are being thorough, it actually possible to put the umbrella back in it case nearly completely dry. Last but not least, the material for the canopy is also surprisingly soft and easily to tie up with the strap; adding to the comfort and joy of using this somewhat large umbrella on raining days.
customer_reviews.author: Reuby

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I've never really spent on an umbrella but this was a worthy investment. The first most striking impression of this umbrella is it's build quality. From the handle to the cover, and the canvas to the frame - everything is well constructed. It is only natural that you would also want to take good care of such an umbrella, given its price, and that only serves to extend its lifespan with you. That's a good thing, because it looks like it will last a long time and is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: K.S. Chong

customer_reviews.title: Love this Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The weather finally got bad enough for me to use my new umbrella. I work downtown among the high rises which means the wind can get pretty strong at times. And this umbrella is holding up well. I love the color and the feel and it is easy to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Heavy compared to other makes, but it's well made, with one caveat: a carrying strap would have been useful. Also, it wobbles in gusty winds, but it didn't break or flip inside-out.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Pettit

customer_reviews.title: The nicest umbrella I ever had
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is fashionably sharp looking for those that like both the sporty and professional look. Pairs well with almost any business suit or business casual attire. It opens and closes well and provide good coverage and can withstand moderate wind gusts.
customer_reviews.author: David Carter

customer_reviews.title: -Definitely Worth a Look!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this umbrella to replace another one that I have had for several years.....and which finally broke. The Balios umbrella is surprisingly lightweight and compact. It also seems to be very sturdy in its rib-frame construction which suggests it should hold up well in high winds. The process of releasing/retracting the umbrella when I am finished with it is a little different than my old unit was; however, it didn't take long to get use to it. I rate the Balios umbrella as a solid purchase and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: K. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great service and product
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with the umbrella after a year of owning it and using it very lightly. The seller was super responsive and made it right, could not be happier with the level of service! Otherwise, we love the look, feel, and performance of this umbrella. Held up really well to some very windy and rainy days, never flipping inside out. Love the wood handle and the colors, and the fabric feels and looks top notch, holding up very well during downpours.
customer_reviews.author: SpencerOC

customer_reviews.title: Refund plz
customer_reviews.text: I want my money back. This didn’t even last a Day. my husband used for the first time recently and just broke under the rain and wind..
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Revision 2
customer_reviews.text: I used it twice and it broke! The mechanism is already not working, the umbrella is stuck half shut and a wire is in a loose loop sticking out. I did nothing special but open and close it. Refund! ** Edit: Customer service contacted me and promptly replaced the faulty unit; the umbrella itself looks quite nice and I like the wooden handle. Looking forward to this one lasting longer. A+ for customer service. Edit 2: Wow. I received a second umbrella as stated above - and it is already broken. I did nothing special but press the button to open/close. Will not bother to try a THIRD one, this umbrella just looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Well made umbrella!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this umbrella. Its compact and well made. Let me list the features that make the Balios is a great umbrella. * Its compact and folds up easily. * You can open and close it with a button. When you push to close it, it actually folds up tightly. * The umbrella doesn't try to fold up when it's windy. It maintains it shape. * The mechanicals of it are sturdy too. I've had cheaper umbrellas that would wobble in strong wind. The Balios holds up to strong wind. * Best of all it keeps you dry! Again, it's a well made umbrella. Great price for such craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and fits my need as a backup.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Shedrain cane umbrella user for most occasions but picked this up to keep in my work backpack. It's a handsome umbrella and so far really water repellent fabric - a shake gets rid of most of the water. It's vented but I haven't had any true Chicago rain storms to test that yet. There is no handle strap which is too bad. To be transparent, the manufacturer offered a three (vs one) year warranty for a review *regardless of rating*. My rating is truthful.
customer_reviews.author: Savedsol

customer_reviews.title: Nothing proof
customer_reviews.text: One hearty gust of wind and it was inside out. Which wouldn't be too awful except that one of the metal pieces on the rib (I think it's a spring bit that is part of the auto close mechanism) came loose. It was super fun when it snagged my hair repeatedly. I was able to use it during a drizzle and as long as there was no wind it worked ok. Autoclose is kind of pointless because while it closes the canopy you still have to muscle it down into the totally collapsed form. I had it with me on vacation and didn't bother to pack it for the return home
customer_reviews.author: BellaBull

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella, refined appearance.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small umbrella for when I travel--so it had to be small, but I really wanted something that was attractive, with a refined look. This umbrella looks fantastic in person. The wood has an even patina, and is not slippery if wet. It's closed size is remarkably small, especially since it opens up as much as it does. I appreciated the inclusion of a travel case as well. Sure, you can get a cheaper umbrella, but if you want something that retains a more formal appearance, you can't get better than this. It opens/closes easily, and it just feels like a quality item. It fits easily into my bag, no problems (so very portable!).
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Classy and beautiful umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: I love this umbrella! I didn't know how classy and beautiful this umbrella actually was. I really like the wood handle, and the cover has a zipper, so it fits perfectly over the umbrella when it is closed. I always had trouble putting on the umbrella cover on other umbrellas, but not this one. It works well, I just push the button and it opens smoothly and quietly. It's really a step up from other umbrellas I have used in the past. It's made well and what looks like great craftsmanship. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a new umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: reader101

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Rain Gear
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and he loves it! The handle is beautiful wood that feels smooth and is carved with finger indentations so that it is comfortable also. The auto open is very nice quality and so are all other materials. It rains frequently in the winter on the Oregon coast and this umbrella will get lots of use. I thought that the price was very reasonable for the quality of this umbrella and would buy it again ( but hope that my husband does not misplace this - umbrellas are kind of like socks in the dryer at our house.....inexplicably lost . Anyway, as a gift or for yourself, this is a really nice umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Vonne

customer_reviews.title: Top-Notch Multi-Functional Self-Defense Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Wowsers! Compact, sturdy, lightweight, and wind-tested. This umbrella is more than I expected. It is also a self-defense device. If you need to give an attacker a solid punch to the gut/other areas, leave the bag on and push the button. With about 40 pounds of focused punch, you can take the mugger's wallet. That you push the button and the canopy folds is just cool. You better eat your Wheaties though, pushing the rod back down towards the handle required a little effort - unless you work smarter and not harder. Place the canopy against a desk or counter and use your weight to firmly press down on the handle. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: William Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Very classy and handsome!
customer_reviews.text: Due to quarantine, I was only able to try this out in my back yard during a light rain. I was so tempted to break out in song like Gene Kelly and dance around the yard! (Maybe I did but I wouldn't admit it). This umbrella is stylish and well built. The seams are absolutely Perfect! Stunning wood handle. One button open and close feels very solid, not flimsy. Please note that the button will fully open the umbrella from completely closed position, but the close feature only collapses the canopy and you have to manually slide it to full closed position. If I find any problems, I will let you know. However, I don't foresee that happening. :)
customer_reviews.author: Cevad

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy umbrella, elegant and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy umbrella, feels strong and works good in the windy rains of New York City. Elegant and stylish, looks really good compared to other umbrellas I have seen. Nice size, enough for two people really close to each other, however, that makes it big enough to take some space in your bag. Is also not as lightweight as other models. Not a truly travel umbrella, I think, more like a city umbrella. When folded, the only way to hold it folded is through the loop in the carrying pouch, because the umbrella itself doesn't have any loop or strap to hold it directly. Not a big deal, but it bothers me fro time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality feel of this umbrella. It is not "weak" in a strong downpour or mild wind. The feel and finish of the handle is excellent. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that there is no leash on the umbrella itself, only on the bag. So essentially you walk through the rain with an umbrella in one hand and the bag it comes in in the other if you want a leash to throw around your wrist once you get indoors. A bit inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rich

customer_reviews.title: Button doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Received it in the mail, unpacked it, button doesn't work. It literally doesn't even feel like it was designed to be pressed, it doesn't budge at all. I read a few other reviews that said it's a bit stiff, but I had 4 different people try it and nobody could press this button in. I then tried a hammer, and then a pair of pliers, still won't press. It wouldn't be so bad if I could just open it manually, but without the button the umbrella doesn't even extend, nor lock in the open position. So it's literally useless.
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: excellent travel umbrella
customer_reviews.text: The size folded is very nice. Small but not tiny. Deployed its regular size for one, though my wife and I can share when we get caught in the rain. This this is sturdy. The deploying spring is STIFF which is fine, but you need two hands to compress it. Took this on several trips to Japan on business and to Europe and used it many, many times. Well worth the price. Also, yellow is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Built to last.
customer_reviews.text: Just a cut above. Crafted with care and the real wood handle sets this umbrella apart from the rest. Fits in my glove compartment. Just slightly larger than my old no-name umbrella with a broken spoke. It was definitely time for an upgrade and I am so glad I got this. Because of its design it allows wind to go though the umbrella helping to keep it from inverting and breaking the spines on a windy day. I have received several comments on my umbrella and I tell them it is a Balios. Important: Make sure you have plenty of space to open umbrella as it is one touch and opens very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Old Coast Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy. The umbrella is very elegant, and it has a double cover, but when it rains it filters the water. Not worthy. I did not have time to return them. As a weapon is useful because is very strong. I bought one for my mother too, based on the reviews, my bad.
customer_reviews.author: Grey

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella stopped working within a month of using it. It doesnt open or close anymore.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Looks can be deceiving, so can positive reviews
customer_reviews.text: I feel duped. All the positive reviews were reassuring but misleading. On revision I now see most of the reviews more often related to the umbrella’s looks rather than the function or performance. This umbrella flipped on the first use, it was a light gust too. Not impressed at all, kinda wish it rained sooner so I could return it but my return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Gravel

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t close upon first open. Looks nice tho
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Chinese made trash with a nice looking embroidered cloth tag reading “Designed in Britain” but Made in PRC (People’s Republic of China). Came in an envelope. Unwrapped it. Pressed the button and opened like a charm. Press to close. Great. Now to smush both ends to close: FAIL. So now I gotta figure out what box I have to get to return this $20 garbage probably not worth returning due to cost of a long box. That’s what I call a scam. Or maybe I jinxed myself by opening it indoors!
customer_reviews.author: Yankees98

customer_reviews.title: Better than your average collapsible umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Had this umbrella for three or four months now. Where I live the rain is usually short but can go from zero to thunderstorm pretty quick. Has held up quite well, and looks pretty to boot. It is much better quality than your average Totes umbrella. The release/opening mechanism is powerful and snappy, so don't point it towards your face when you open it! The wind resistance provided by the double canopy is alright, but more importantly it keeps most of me dry in the storms in my area. It's a little bit heftier than my old cheap umbrellas, but that's definitely more due to quality instead of cheap flimsy materials.
customer_reviews.author: Statistical ArtistTop Contributor: Watercolor Painting

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Didn't do as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It broke the first time I used it. I was out on a windy day in New England (not near the coast) and the winds couldn't have been more than 10-15 mph. The umbrella did like most umbrellas and broke when the wind caught it and it popped up breaking one of the umbrella arms. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M. 19 Year Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Well made and decorative umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a one handed umbrella that broke. Wow just opening it from it's 2 covers and paper wrapped handle told me something. The company cares about workmanship and details!! I have not used this yet,but when I opened the umbrella I could immediately see the reinforced brackets and things inside are well made and will last a long time. The size is good. This umbrella is not small, yet not over large. The mechanism to open and close it was smooth and quick. I know I will enjoy using this umbrella. Probably for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I did order two of this umbrella. Gray and brown. After 3 uses the gray one handle can't be pushed back any more to retracted position. The handle stay extended and canopy won't lock in the open position. Will see how long the brown one will last. After posting my review Rick from Bailos contacted me through email and gave me a refund without even sending back the defective umbrella. This company really cares about their customers satisfaction, and he also offered a 99% discount towards the purchase of another umbrella. Thank you for reaching out, by the way I do own 3 more Bailos's umbrellas they all look and work great. More power to you 😍
customer_reviews.author: Squid1987

customer_reviews.title: An Umbrella unlike any other
customer_reviews.text: The Bailos umbrella has revolutionized the experience of using an umbrella! Seriously. This model automatically opens for you. CLOSES 3/4 of the way, doing all the hard work for you but still allowing you to shake the water from it. Best of all, the handle....its not a HOOK! I will never understand this ineffecient and silly design of most all umbrellas. The Bailos has a polished, lovely wood grain handle that is solid and thick and straight. Highly recommend for young professionals, adults, MEN. I bought this for my man and he LOVES it
customer_reviews.author: ClaireCatt

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Amazon products on the market.  No seriously
customer_reviews.text: Best umbrella I have found. Compact and easy on the eye. The umbrella has 2 cannopies and has held up in some serious NYC rain and wind gusts. The tunnel affect coming through the streets of midtown can be crazy due to the tall buildings. This umbrella is fashionable and functional and is under 25 bucks. The cover is easy to put on and off due to the sizeable zipper. Every other umbrella has had the cover tossed within 5 minutes because I cant stand shoving a whole umbrella into a small bag. This cover fits perfectly. Cant sing enough praises about this one button open/close compact, 2 canopy, strong fashionable umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I paid a bit more for this umbrella and find it is worth the cost. The wooden handle is good looking. The design of the umbrella is solid. It doesn’t rain often we’re I live but when it does it also tends to be very windy. 12 mph winds are pretty average here. The umbrella keeps you dry in the face of heavy winds. You can use it with being concerned that it’s going to give or get broken during a rain storm.
customer_reviews.author: Dicax

customer_reviews.title: What Happened?
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this umbrella 3X's for myself and Loved it so much I gave them as gifts. This last time I knew that I would keep this one for myself. I used it for the first time a week ago and I was showing it off to everyone that wanted to see but when I reached the store and pushed the button to close it nothing. It would not close. Got out the store and nothing it would not close. I am going to buy another one as I think the date has passed to return or exchange. I still love this umbrella and no one else has told me that they had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: A Great Umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this umbrella for the past 6 months in Seattle, and it has been flawless. It has a very ridged frame, a nice wooden handle, and an amazingly powerful opening and closing mechanism. (I mean seriously don't point this at somebody) It has kept me dry in huge downpours and has not bent in 40mph winds. Spend the extra money it's worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about a week
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a week. Now the upper part of the umbrella pole will not slide past the bottom part, And the canopy stays folded. I would still use it without being able to slide the pole down, but the canopy will not stay open. Too cheap to return. Bought better umbrellas for a few bucks that I picked up at a check-out counter.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bumbershoot
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a classic British made Umbrella.. this one has pleased me greatly.. the construction is study and I like the fact they use carbon fiber now on a lot of them.. it's compact and lightweight and the material sheets rain off like it is not even coming down.. The vent helps immensely and I also like how it will snap closed after use.. Very nice brolly.. I will definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Aurihazuma

customer_reviews.title: Very nice travel umbrella
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is a great size; it's small enough to be tucked away, but folds open to be large enough to protect you from the rain. It feels very well made, I hope it holds up to extended use over time. The handle feels nice; not some crappy plastic handle like most other umbrellas have. My only complaint is that the loop you can hold it from when folded up is on the umbrella's case. So unless you put it back in it's case after use, it's harder to carry since there isn't a loop attached directly to it. I miss that, but not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Evans

customer_reviews.title: Shaft will not compress back to “packing” size but customer service took care of it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in March of 2019 and tossed in my business bag for travel. The first time I used it, 2 months later, the umbrella shaft would not collapse back down. It was impossible to repack the umbrella. I can’t find away to contact the company to file a claim. Updated 5/29/2017 - A couple days after having this problem Balios customer service hooked me up with a replacement umbrella. This one works great. I've changed my rating both as a result of the customer service and the fact this second umbrella works as good as it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, faulty spring to open/close
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value for an umbrella. It has a nice wooden handle, which is exactly what I was looking for. It's compact but the canopy feels large when opened up. Unfortunately, the spring in my umbrella was a bit hard to close. A friend of mine accidentally applied to much force and busted the closing action. I couldn't fix it. One other very small gripe: they use this cheap looking gold-tone snap to fasten the umbrella closed. It just doesn't match the color or quality of the other hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B

customer_reviews.title: Met 3 criteria
customer_reviews.text: I travel into the city by bus and have to walk several city blocks from the bus stop to my building. It is always great having an umbrella in rainy days and I was looking for 3 specific qualities. First, I needed it to big enough to provide cover yet small enough that carry in my bag in the bus. I needed it to be sturdy, holding up to wind gusts. Finally, I did not want something that looked cheap. I am happy with the Balios Pestige Travel Umbrella
customer_reviews.author: Redtur

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be my favorite umbrella I've ever used. I usually just buy a real cheap one from a local store when the rainy season starts, maybe once every couple years. They just seem to never hold up very long. But this Umbrella not only looks nice, it even has a better quality feel. It's sturdy but comfortable to hold because of the wooden handle, which looks even better in person. Never reviewed an Umbrella before, but this one deserved it! Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Romero

customer_reviews.title: Quality and style
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for something made to last, that won’t fall apart in the wind you’ve found the right umbrella. Sleek and elegant design with a beautiful wooden handle that fits nicely in hand. The slide to open is smooth and easy to use. Length when folded is about 14 inches so it’s not going to fit in a small handbag but what it lacks in versatility it makes up for in quality and style.
customer_reviews.author: Ara

customer_reviews.title: This is An Umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: I have really looked to find a compact umbrella that feels and operates like a solid piece of equipment. This one makes the cut for me. It's beautiful to hold in my hand. It opens effortlessly. The handle is very classy looking. Even the exterior cover is solid looking. I just love it. I have yet to test it in a storm, but when I do, I'll come back and update my review. Thank you for making and selling such a great umbrella!
customer_reviews.author: H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good option for a stylish, compact umbrella at a great price. I generally use a full length umbrella, so the rib construction is not quite what I am used to, but it has held up in wind and rain just fine so far. I am very impressed with the wood handle; it both looks and feels exceptional. Unfortunately, I dropped it the very first day. Fortunately, the handle only dented slightly on the asphalt, without any real sign of damage unless you are holding it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cutting

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and Strong Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is excellent quality for the price. The canopy is a good quality material supported by a sturdy frame. It was this nicely carved wooden handle which makes it look really elegant and folds up nicely into zip-up pouch which fits perfectly into my handbag. My favorite part is the open/close button. My open/close mechanism on my old umbrella was a metal piece that felt like a blade that was going to cut through my thumb. This umbrella just opens and closes easily at the press of a button.
customer_reviews.author: Vashna

customer_reviews.title: So good someone else had to have it.
customer_reviews.text: This was a very great looking and feeling umbrella. Only had it for a few days before someone stole it from me, but who am I deny someone this umbrella. I can see why they wanted it. It's very solid feeling in your hand, you instantly feel classier. The open and close mechanism was great, made it very easy getting in and out of my car and it was big and sturdy and kept me dry in the rain. I want another one...
customer_reviews.author: C.Leong

customer_reviews.title: Holds up in the wind.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this umbrella a few times since purchasing; however, on a particularly windy (gusts to 40mph+), and very rainy day, it held up extremely well in the wind and the rain, personally I think it is a very good value for the cost! If they offered the same umbrella, with a larger double canopy, and the same open/close collapsible design, I would most definitely buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Toma

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I really like this umbrella, and the handle is a big part of that. It has finger indentations, making it easier to keep a good grip. The button to open is easily reachable for even smaller hand sizes. As a dog walker, I carry an umbrella rain or shine to scare off loose dogs, which needs quick reaction. It is also very sturdy and holds up well in rainstorms.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen McBrair

customer_reviews.title: Update: too small for me but awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: If you are a full grown adult and want to look stylish but don’t mind getting wet because the umbrella is only big enough for a kid, then this is the umbrella for you! Oh, they are going to charge you 5.99 to return it, so make sure you want an overpriced kid’s umbrella before you buy it! Now I’m stuck with it and looking for another umbrella to buy. Update: customer service jumped on this immediately and resolved the situation. This company knows what customer satisfaction means! I hope they make a larger umbrella and I will buy two!
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Balios Travel Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a travel umbrella and upon looking, decided to get this one. I saw that it was unisex but also masculine looking at the same time. The umbrella is great quality for the price. While traveling, I did have to use it and it did turn upside down on me, but I quickly recovered from that and didn't get really wet. If you're considering this umbrella for a compact, light, fashionable, travel choice, then its a good option.
customer_reviews.author: DJK30

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's an umbrella, but the touch button auto and close feature is brilliant. I literally unpacked the first one, opened and closed it twice and the ordered a second one. Next I will be ordering a larger size one if they offered. Plus I love the wood handle. The umbrella is for my car and the wood matches the wood grain in my car.
customer_reviews.author: EDC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these umbrellas; one for my car, and 1 for my house. The fabric feels very nice and the mechanism is higher quality than my cheap pocket umbrella. I really like these. The wooden handle is very good quality, but makes the umbrella heavier. I think I would prefer less weight, but this is such good quality I'll get over it.
customer_reviews.author: Free At Last

customer_reviews.title: Nice umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this umbrella because I thought it looked elegant with the handle being made of wood. Several of the reviews said something about it not being made too well, and I was a little concerned about that. While I've only bought economical $10 versions at stores before, this one is definitely made nicer and looks great! While we don't have really strong winds where I live in the Pacific NW, I have been in some light wind and not had any problems with it being grabbed from my hand. It doesn't have a cord to stick around your wrist, which I am used to, but other than that it is great!
customer_reviews.author: caressak

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, great working compact umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually not a huge fan of compact umbrellas since they're usually tacky looking or have a cheap feel to them. Not this one! You can tell it's a quality umbrella: it has a really nice ergonomic wood handle, the buttons and moving parts are responsive and smooth, and the fabric itself seems to be quite nice. In my campus bookstore, a shoddy Storm Duds brand umbrella would cost about the same, so I'm really happy with price too! Indeed, it feels more expensive than it actually is, so why not give it as a gift?
customer_reviews.author: Sal Silva

customer_reviews.title: I would give it a 5 but the buckle clip doesn't close.
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful umbrella, this is my second one (i lost my first one), but with this one, the buckle doesn't close. I have to wrap it tight to put it back in the sleeve to zip it up. I cant return it because i NEED an umbrella, but i would purchase it again in the future. Fyi, ive only used this one once, but again, I've had another one for a couple of years before i lost it, and it worked very well under heavy rain and wind, which is why i purchased it again. Just bumbed that it doesn't buckle.
customer_reviews.author: VEGAN

customer_reviews.title: DIFFICULT TO CLOSE
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy well made. With the door only partly open as in a parking space with another car on the left it was hard to close and lock the umbrella. A small woman might find it very difficult. I have just received an email from Balios offering a full refund without needing to send back umbrella. Therefore I am adding one star.
customer_reviews.author: A C Mason

customer_reviews.title: great umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Love this unbrella. Great size and great for travel. Only one negative. It has a wrist strap on the cover so if you cover it, you can easily put on your arm if need to. The umbrella itself does not have a wrist strap. I would love it if the manufacturer would add one. I don't like having to put back in sleeve everytime I use it. Otherwise, great product.
customer_reviews.author: tango

customer_reviews.title: These are the best umbrellas I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find a great umbrella, but this is the best one I have ever owned. The wooden handle is beautifully finished, the frame is very sturdy, and the vented canopy performs well in wind. The automatic operation is seamless and reliable. I bought three of them. Highly recommended. Balios, please do not decrease the quality of this item! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: BCRREVIEW

customer_reviews.title: Quality build. Had for about a month or so, still fully functional.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that you can open and close it down with the press of a button. The wooden handle feeds solid and the whole things feels pretty luxurious. I haven't had any issues with flipping thus far, and it's pretty wide, so even for a big guy like myself, it can cover me pretty well against the rain. The one downside is that it doesn't have a wrist strap on this particular model, but if you don't expect your umbrella to fall out of your hand and fly away, this shouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: These people know rain, and this brolly is beautiful
customer_reviews.text: All of the details are very intentional and well crafted. The polished wood handle is very tactile and comfortable. I like that it's compact so I can have it in a bag or tucked in the car. Its not lightweight so much, but I think that's a strength. It's not needlessly weighty, but because of the quality of materials. Good umbrellas are hard to find, and really difficult to discover unless in hand. I recommend this for the price to prove it's value over long time use.
customer_reviews.author: LCollins

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel, but inverts at first gust
customer_reviews.text: The material is nice in that it drys fast since it repels water, and the handle feels great since it's wood. However the umbrella will flip with even a moderate first of wind and the buttcap screw at the top broke in two after the second use. If you're just dealing with a moderate rain with no wind it's nice, but it won't hold up in even moderate winds. Update: Great customer service. Seller reached out quickly and even offered a refund. Will see about putting this towards one of their walking umbrellas instead =)
customer_reviews.author: randomvs

customer_reviews.title: Really solid well made product
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful full-size handle( the handle is often too small on travel umbrellas). The wood handle is very uncommon on modestly priced umbrellas. The vented canopy gives me confidence that this one won't turn inside out in a heavy rain. I may have to buy a second umbrella for the passenger side of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Too small and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The diameter of the cupola is too small when opened - even for one person. Small coverage in real rain. The shaft is not sturdy but shaky and the cupola doesn't lock in the opened position. Therefore, the opened umbrella feels flimsy in the hand. Also, the center cap on top of the cupola just fell off when the umbrella was first test opened. Had to put it back on. Returned. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: zz

customer_reviews.title: This umbrella makes me happy
customer_reviews.text: I think everyone deserves to have something small that's elegant and gives them a little bit of confidence and pleasure. This umbrella does just that for me. While it's not super expensive, it is unique and fits my personality quite well. I'm the sort of person who buys things for their function over aesthetic, and don't have many cool-looking things because of that. But this umbrella accommodates both of those needs. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jake M

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid - Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Great Umbrella, very sturdy and well crafted.The wood handle fits well in the hand and is an elegant touch to an otherwise ordinary umbrella. The spring-loaded push button is extremely responsive and easy to use. The only "problem" I have with mine is that to press the button to retract the umbrella after use I sometimes need to give it a bit of a shake before the button is able to be used (i.e. it stays pressed in). This is an extremely minor complaint - otherwise, the umbrella is fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Seth Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great company.
customer_reviews.text: Update on my review: After posting my earlier review the company reached out to me. They were so great and went over and beyond to fix the issue. They stand by their product. This is a great company to purchase from. I've used the umbrella a handful of times and loved it. This last weekend I was using it, and a gust of wind came up and it folded the umbrella inside out quickly, and one of the prongs broke. I'm sad and will be shopping for a new umbrella soon.
customer_reviews.author: Sharilyn Shaeffer

customer_reviews.title: Great compact umbrella that stands up to Chicago wind
customer_reviews.text: I’ve lost my fair share of umbrellas to Chicago’s wind. This umbrella handles the wind with ease. It is the perfect size--small enough to stow in my bag. Further, it has a lot of nice details that reflect the quality craftsmanship: the snap that secured the closed umbrella is heavy duty, the wood handle looks great, the storage bag is nice and thick so water doesn’t leak out, and the zipper on the storage bag is heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrating after sporadic use
customer_reviews.text: It's attractive, quite comfortable, and held up well in heavy rain and wind the few times I used it. Seemed well made, however after maybe ten uses, and ten more times I carried it around in my bag (roomy bag), the wires are poking through the fabric. How hard is it to make an umbrella that survives being used as such for a while?
customer_reviews.author: magdush smith

customer_reviews.title: Very Daper
customer_reviews.text: I like that this actually looks nice when you are walking with it. The umbrella is well built and I have had no issues with it. During our last rain it kept me dry and when I closed it up the water just bounced off it. Just the perfect size to keep me dry. The open and close function is nice for when you are getting in and out of your car.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my wife as we just moved to the East Coast of the United States. Designed in London and made in China, this umbrella seems sturdy and very nicely made. It could easily be given as a gift. I'm almost tempted to take it back from her, gift wrap it, and we present it to her as a loving gift.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: My favorite umbrella
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is the best one I’ve ever owned. It held up through those crazy windy Texas storms last fall and winter. I’ve thrown away countless umbrellas because they turn wrong-side out and break in high winds. This umbrella never even flinched. It’s lightweight, looks great, and is compact. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: KahunaCasa

customer_reviews.title: Nice and stylish.
customer_reviews.text: Omg this umbrella is really nice in person once u actually hold it. Keep in mind I just had small cheap black umbrellas. So definitely a step up. Great for windy days doesnt just easily fold, unless u actually are facing the wind. When I'm ready to put it away I give it a good shake to get rid of the water and let me say it repels water pretty good. It's own bag for the umbrella came in a bigger larger bag so tht was fancy!
customer_reviews.author: Yoboihdez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and function
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Balios umbrella! Generally, I'm not a person who uses umbrellas at all. But after moving to the South where we get rainstorms all year long, I finally caved. The feel of the wood handle is really comfortable in my hand. It's small enough to fit in my backpack or large purse-bag, yet big enough to provide adequate covered for storms. It also comes with two waterproof covers to help mitigate the whole wet-umbrella-making-a-mess situation, which I definitely appreciate!
customer_reviews.author: Claire A

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella is crafted with top of the line materials and has a solid wood handle. I was amazed at how well the umbrella held up with rain and wind. I also was surprised at how balanced the umbrella was while using it. It has a very easy button to press to open and has great ease when collapsing the umbrella after use. I would recommend this umbrella not only for the quality but for the design as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has been a great little umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a travel umbrella to visit south china this summer, went thru 25 days and the recent tropical storm and did great. dried fast, the mechanism has been sturdy, has held up in moderate gusts just fine (haven't really tried it in exceptionally strong winds) and has survived being banged around in the overhead bin a bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Matt E

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I am confident with this umbrella. Quite reliable and built well. The reason for applying the last star is because the placement of the snap strand that holds the umbrella closed is not placed in unity with the elegant wood handle grip. When held properly, the strand hangs down right in the front. It annoys me during my rainy walk. Other than that, I feel like a sophisticated Englishman when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: bdad

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective
customer_reviews.text: Overall quality and materials felt rather cheap and fragile than claimed wind-proof. On top of that it arrived with a broken rib. The only nice element seemed to be the wooden handle that was really nice and elegant. Refunded and moving on to something else. Edit: Customer support contacted me the next day and their representative was very nice. They offered a free umbrella of my choice on top of the issued refund, so I will give it a second go.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: Hefty
customer_reviews.text: Nice vented umbrella; elegant wooden handle with high end silver trim is good size for easy grip. Auto open/close is awesome. I keep mine in my car door, so the fact that it's heavy isn't a problem for me, but if you carry it in a backpack or bag it may be. The only issue I had was that the snap on the strap is a cheap looking gold color and doesn't match the silver trim at all. I sanded the finish off and now it looks like brushed stainless: much better.
customer_reviews.author: queen.b

customer_reviews.title: Not designed well for the metro city commuter.
customer_reviews.text: Update: the company contacted me and issued a full refund and stands by their product. This is a huge plus! The canopy is on the small side compared to others I have had, the handle is smooth and slips out of your hand easily as it has no ridges to grip AND it has no wrist loop which if you are a urban city commuter, it’s important. I’m returning it for another. The telescope rod wouldn’t collapse and broke on the first use.
customer_reviews.author: xmas

customer_reviews.title: Great travel accessory
customer_reviews.text: I've never bought an umbrella online before, but I was looking for one that was a bit classier than the average $5 version you can find in most stores. This one was perfect! The canopy has a second layer, so it's much sturdier than I was expecting. The wooden handle is also a nice touch. It opens and collapses easily with the push of a button.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Green

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing purchase! I was looking for an elegant umbrella and this exactly what I was looking for. It's handle extremely strong and it has not bent. It is exactly as advertised, it is, in fact, windproof and its handle is actual wood. This beautiful and elegant umbrella was not made with low-quality materials. I cannot say enough how happy I am with my purchase! This is the first umbrella ever that has not broken or flown away. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Bejarano

customer_reviews.title: Replacement is doing well so far
customer_reviews.text: Nice umbrella except for the fact that 2 spokes snapped after a gust of wind during my first few hours of use. Don't waste your money. Update: Balios reached out to me and will be sending me a replacement umbrella free of charge. I may revise rating depending on the quality of the replacement. If nothing else, their customer service is pretty top-notch. Update 2: Pleased with the replacement umbrella, thumbs up to Balios for their excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Benjie Dayco

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but not the most durable.
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella lasted me about 6 months. Pros: - Its very nice looking, the handle and materials used are nice. - Its compact, and work well in light rain. Con's: - I was caught in 20-30mph wind and it was destroyed. It wouldn't function after the wind inverted it destroying the metal extender arms. Overall, I liked it. If you plan on only using it in light rain, and are careful with it, it's not bad. If you want an umbrella that can handle more sever weather/strong winds, I would look for a more durable brand. This is more of a style over function product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality - one button Open Close
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet but very impressed with the quality of the umbrella. Build quality and materials are very good. Most fun thing is the auto open close at a push of a button - still have to push the steam in manually. The air vent on the top hopefully will release the pressure and avoid sudden wind pressure damage. Looking forward to years of hassle free use.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly smooth mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift, I was pleasantly surprised by how nice it was. It mechanically opens and closes (I’ve never seen one that closes this way before). It’s a bit stiff getting it all the way closed however it might get easier with use. It seems very well made, I can’t speak to durability yet...will see how it does this Winter!
customer_reviews.author: Beach Bummer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality umbrella
customer_reviews.text: The Sunbrella is high-quality. It has a vent at the top so it does not flip backwards if you get a gust of wind. The wooden handle is a good size and fits your hand nicely. There is a slight arch for comfort. My husband is left handed and I am right handed. It works great for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonomous

customer_reviews.title: Great optics and haptics
customer_reviews.text: Update: The below described situation seems to be an exception. (Purchased a new one) As written below, the umbrella has a great quality regarding optics and haptics. So far it proves very durable and the open/close mechanism works exceptionally well. The first impression was very good — the handle feels good, the open/close mechanism works well. But it did not take long until the quality issues arrived. After only a few uses, the zipper came off the cover and worse, one of the arms is falling apart which makes it annoying to close. Update: Umbrella broke after normal use and cannot be closed anymore. — Do yourself a favor and stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Quality umbrella
customer_reviews.text: A very well made umbrella that opens and closes with the push of a button. So why only 4 stars? For me, the handle is not that comfortable , and I wish there was a loop on the umbrella itself, instead of on the cover. It would be easier to carry it around when closed. When I take a cover off an umbrella, it never goes back on again, so a loop on the handle area would be more convenient
customer_reviews.author: Yosefaaron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent umbrella. High quality and finish is excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent umbrella. High quality and finish is excellent. In addition to the storage sleeve shown, it also comes with a light fabric bag which is nice as it covers the entire wooden handle. Overall very satisfied with this product. The only complaint (and it was hard to find one) would be the button snap is bronze while the other metal parts are a silver, doesn't quite match, but hardly worth noting.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I've just used this once or twice so far since I got it, but it has worked well. It's nicely made, and it has more satisfying fit and finish than the less expensive umbrellas I've used before. The auto-close feature is handy for ducking into a doorway without needing a second hand free to close it. You still need to manually collapse the shaft, but instantly retracting the canopy with one button push makes entering a building or vehicle easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Blair

customer_reviews.title: After a year...
customer_reviews.text: Amending original review. It’s pretty, but apparently crap. I’ve used this a hand full of times with no issues until today. It’s torrential here, so grabbed umbrella for dentist appt. Got in & it will not close...at all. Stuck open like 2nd pic. I have to use my hand to hold the umbrella out open. Noticed the strings that are sticking out at top which never showed before. Given that I’ve had it for a year I’m assuming I’m not able to return or exchange. So I’ll be throwing an expensive under-used umbrella in the trash. Not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Rich

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, high-quality umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully made umbrella and it works great! I love the auto open/close feature and the vents that keep it stronger in windy conditions. The only feature I wish it had is a strap/loop at the handle end. My old umbrella had that and I liked that I could strap that around my wrist as I carried it.
customer_reviews.author: J. K.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice umbrella for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really nice umbrella for the price. It fits nicely in my work bag and it easy to take out and put away. I've had it for a few months and it's still working great, and I love in Seattle, so I have used it quite a bit. (Yes, I'm in Seattle and I use an umbrella, and no, I'm not from out of town.)
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: Top button  & wrist loop
customer_reviews.text: I really like this umbrella. The fold-away size is perfect for me, plus it is well made. However, I do have two complaints: 1. the top button on the umbrella easily becomes dislodged. A better adhesive or some other securing method should be used, and 2. there should be a wrist loop on the handle. If your hands are full, a wrist loop would be very convenient and helpful. Correct these two issues & I'll give the umbrella six stars.
customer_reviews.author: William P. Komar

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, especially handle + 1 year replacement warranty that works
customer_reviews.text: Don't often write reviews, and I am not a huge umbrella user, but this is the nicest umbrella I've owned in any price range close to this. The handle has finger grips and it made of real wood. I gave everything 5 stars except the quality, if only because one of the inside spokes did break on me towards the end of the first year - but the silver lining is they have an unlimited replacement warranty for the first year (the description in one area says on 6mos, but I just got a promo code for my replacement at 11mos). They were quick and responsive. Fully recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: One of the coolest things about this umbrella is that you use the automatic button to both open and close the umbrella. No more having to struggle to close an umbrella. Brilliant! The only negative on this umbrella is that it is somewhat heavy but I would definitely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: sally

customer_reviews.title: Ok Quality
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella looks and feels great. It's made of very soft high-quality fabric, including the zippered case it comes in. However, the construction leaves much to be desired. I purchased this product because the wind ruined my previous one. I used it for the first time yesterday and a gust of wind inverted the umbrella. I only hope it holds up, I'll be sure to update this post to vouch for it's quality one way or the other.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Like some other users suggested I would like it more ...
customer_reviews.text: It is everything it claims to be. Like some other users suggested I would like it more if they had a string attached at the end of the wooden handle. It is also a bit hard for me to push down the umbrella in order to close it. So I think people who are skinny like me, kids, or older people might find that part to be difficult but overall it's a good umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

product_meta.title: Balios Prestige Travel Umbrella, Real Wood Handle, Auto Open & Close, Vented Windproof Double Canopy, Designed in UK
feature_bullets: MODEL:DARK NAVY WITH REALWOOD HANDLE; PERFECT LIFESTYLE ACCESSORY with Auto Open/Close feature.
ICONIC BRITISH DESIGN - Designed in Britain (made in PRC); Patented luxurious handmade wood handle.
BEST MATERIAL POSSIBLE: 300T finest fabric; Steel shaft; Fiberglass ribs; Vented Double Canopy.
ARTISAN CRAFTSMANSHIP & RIGOROUS QUALITY CONTROL: 146 painstaking steps, 18 points of inspection.
COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE: ONE YEAR warranty; Replacement supplied absolutely FREE with NO limit.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
